sources.description: Singer | Actor | Composer | Songwriter ÙFlemming Bamse JÃ¸rgensen (February 7th, 1947 - January 1st, 2011) One of Denmark's best known and longest running singers, Flemming JÃ¸rgensen (he earned the nickname Bamse as the leader of the band Bamses Venner, another long running tradition in Danish pop and rock) was born in 1947 in Northampton. With the Bamses Venner, which was founded in 1973, JÃ¸rgensen became a household name in his native country, and in 1980 finished 14th at the Eurovision Song Contest with the song "Taenker Altid Pa Dig" (or "Always Thinking of You," in English). Over the years, JÃ¸rgensen would go on to record a great many albums and singles, and in 2007, released his 34th full-length, Love Me Tender, which was a tribute collection of 14 of Elvis Presley's best-known ballads. Flemming "Teddybear" Jorgensen played trumpet as a child before the guitar took over and made her debut as a 16-year-old at a local youth festival. He came by chance into show business in the mid-1960s, when some friends were missing a bass player in the orchestra Les Marques barbed wire and he was l... ater vokalist in the same group. The group later called themselves Perkings Lee came particularly to play in the Top Ten club in Hamburg. He was skilled as a Mechanic in Aarhus before he dared to invest wholeheartedly in the music. In 1973 he formed the "Friends Bears" who made her debut with the single "Blodtud" and in 1975 hittede they "get stuffed" and "Vimmersvej". That same year had Teddybear alone a big hit with "tears speak the truth."
